intro: Boechera nevadensis, commonly known as the Sierra Polygonum, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbages. The plant typically grows in alpine and subalpine regions, where it thrives in rocky and well-drained soils. Its small, white or pale purple flowers bloom in early spring, and it produces small, rounded pods that contain several seeds. Boechera nevadensis is adapted to cold climates and is often found in mountainous areas of Nevada and California.
